metadata.name: Through the Valley
metadata.description:
When I entered the Truso Valley, a remote hiking spot in the mountainous region of Kazbegi, Georgia, I knew I was headed where modern civilization stops and time goes back a few decades.

The area is filled with interesting sights, such as a mineral lake with vibrant red streams coming out of it, abandoned villages, a monastery and a fortress, which make for an exciting 21km hike.

However, luck was on my side that day, and I got to experience something that doesn't happen everyday.

Only about half an hour had gone by since I started hiking,  and the scenery was unreal, with Terek river running through the valley and steep mountains all around it, revealing at each turn.

A bunch of black and white dots started appearing at the end of the trail, and I swiftly realized that I was about to get swept away by thousand of cows and sheep.

After what felt like hours waiting for the animals to come through, I got close to them and looked for the right scene to portray that incredible moment
